channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Brazilian mayor launches furious attack on 'stupid' Bolsonaro over coronavirus response
Brazil's Supreme Court releases video of President Bolsonaro
item.description: Brazil's Supreme Court released a video of President Jair Bolsonaro meeting with members of his cabinet last month. Bolsonaro can be heard swearing several times on the nearly 2-hour long video, which is part of an inquiry into allegations he sought to interfere with federal police investigations. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

item.title: China's national security law seems impossible to stop
Hong Kong police fire tear gas on pro-democracy protesters
item.description: Tensions are escalating between Hong Kong police and pro-democracy protesters demonstrating against China's controversial security proposal for the city. CNN's Anna Coren reports.

item.title: Austrian hospital completes first coronavirus lung transplant in Europe
Why Donald Trump's wild weekend can't be normalized
Some Americans take a holiday from social distancing
item.description: At a glance, it may look like many Americans have long forgotten about the dangers of coronavirus.

item.title: How sex workers are surviving in the age of social distancing
item.description: Don't kiss. Tell clients to wash their hands before they touch you. Wear a mask. Avoid face-to-face positions. And even: Put on a nurse costume and pull out a thermometer -- if his temperature is normal, make it part of the game. If he has a fever, end the session.

item.title: Twitter remains silent about Trump's appalling attack against Joe Scarborough
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: Trump threatens to pull Republican convention out of North Carolina
item.description: President Donald Trump began a solemn Memorial Day railing against North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, a Democrat, ahead of the 2020 Republican National Convention, threatening to pull it out of Charlotte, where the convention is expected to be held August 24 to 27.

item.title: CNN reporter: Beachgoer told me to 'get out of his country'
item.description: CNN's Natasha Chen describes a hostile encounter with a beachgoer while reporting on location in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.

item.title: What you need to know about coronavirus today
Health officials warned to look out for rare condition that almost took this boy's life
item.description: "The doctors were shocked. They said they had never seen anything like this," says Valentina Vigilante, recalling the terrifying day her 6-year-old son Nicolò was rushed into intensive care in Bergamo, northern Italy, as he struggled to breathe.

item.title: Boris Johnson draws media fire from all sides after top aide accused of lockdown breach
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has managed the rare feat of bringing together British newspapers from across the political spectrum to demand he sack a top aide accused of breaking strict lockdown rules.

item.title: New Zealand PM shook by earthquake during TV interview
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has been something of a nightmare for live TV, with interviews interrupted by children, cats, ringing phones, dogs and now, earthquakes.

item.title: Queen guitarist Brian May rushed to hospital after heart attack
item.description: Queen guitarist Brian May has revealed that he was rushed to the hospital by his doctor after suffering a heart attack.

item.title: India's airports begin to reopen
item.description: After two months of closures, airports across India begin reopening today, May 25.

item.title: Fareed: Trump seems to be desperate
item.description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria says Democrats are wrong to let the GOP strategy of scapegoating China affect their 2020 campaign, and that decision could have lasting consequences.

item.title: The largest volcano in the world sits beneath two small rocky peaks in Hawaii
item.description: With two barren peaks that rise only about 170 feet above sea level, the now extinct Pūhāhonu volcano in the Northwestern Hawaii Islands doesn't look like much. This is especially true since in the same archipelago, Mauna Loa towers over every other volcano at 30,000 feet.

item.title: I was trapped naked on a German fire escape
item.description: It's 10 years ago. I'm on a road trip to Germany with my then boyfriend.

item.title: Delta and United Airlines caught up in rising US-China tensions
item.description: Rising tensions between the United States and China are spilling over into the airline industry.

item.title: Women are told more lies than men in workplace reviews, new research suggests. And that can prevent gender equality.
item.description: Turns out, gender bias in the workplace is just as detrimental as you may think.

item.title: Watch laser destroy aircraft mid-flight
item.description: The US Navy has successfully tested a new high-energy laser weapon that can destroy aircraft mid-flight, the Navy's Pacific Fleet said in a statement Friday.

item.title: Biscuits and Gravy, the kitten born with two faces, dies
item.description: Biscuits and Gravy, the kitten with two faces, has died days after capturing the hearts of animal lovers all over the world.

item.title: Rwanda has enlisted anti-epidemic robots in its fight against coronavirus
item.description: Rwanda has introduced robots as part of its fight against coronavirus.

item.title: Why one man owns 2,371 cell phones
item.description: Jayesh Kale is a collector in India who has spent at least five years gathering cell phones, calling the devices in the collection his "babies."

item.title: The pandemic is causing an exponential rise in the online exploitation of children, experts say
item.description: At first glance, Shelley Allwang's cubicle looks just like any other office space.

item.title: Man accused of beating 75-year-old in Detroit nursing home pleads not guilty to assault and other charges
item.description: The 20-year-old man accused of beating a 75-year-old in a Detroit nursing home pleaded not guilty to assault Sunday, said Maria Miller, Wayne County assistant prosecuting attorney.

item.title: Elon Musk and Grimes have changed their baby's name. A bit
item.description: Just when you thought you'd learned how to spell Grimes and Elon Musk's unusual baby name, they've gone and changed it.

item.title: JioMart expands to 200 cities in India as it seeks to compete with Amazon and FlipKart
item.description: An online grocery business backed by Asia's richest man is expanding to hundreds of cities across India — a move widely seen as a challenge to Amazon and FlipKart.

item.title: Aerial video shows holiday crowd in Daytona Beach
item.description: Video released by the Volusia County Sheriff's Office shows a crowd of people not socially distancing while celebrating Memorial Day weekend in Daytona Beach, Florida. A person making a rap video caused a disturbance when they began throwing money from a car, according to Sheriff Mike Chitwood. CNN's Ana Cabrera talks to Mayor Derrick Henry about how the city is managing during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Rare natural event happens amid virus crisis
item.description: James Wood is looking for a tree.

item.title: Tom Brady hits incredible shot, then splits his trousers
item.description: It was a mouth-watering prospect for sports-starved fans everywhere. Four of the greatest athletes the world has ever known, on the golf course at the same time, offering us a glimpse of who they are when they aren't winning Major Championships and Super Bowl trophies.

item.title: Covid-19 is making these used cars cheaper
item.description: With travelers staying close to home and airports turned into virtual ghost towns, rental car companies have taken a huge hit during the coronavirus pandemic. On Friday Hertz, which also operates the Dollar and Thrifty agencies, declared bankruptcy. Industry experts expect the company to sell off a large portion of its fleet.

item.title: Taylor Swift fans think she outsmarted Scooter Braun with song cover
item.description: Did Taylor Swift execute a chess move against music executive Scooter Braun?

item.title: Vanessa Bryant shares adorable video of baby Capri's first steps
item.description: Vanessa Bryant, wife of the late Kobe Bryant, shared a sweet moment this Memorial Day weekend -- a film of their baby daughter's first steps.

item.title: Inside the secluded and intimate New York studios of famous artists
item.description: Artist studios have long been mythologized as a hallowed private space, where artists are swept up in the frenzy of creation or host fabled meetings of the minds.

item.title: How beer helped save this US pizza chain
item.description: Zeeks Pizza is keeping the great American tradition of pizza and beer alive, while also saving its business during the pandemic.

item.title: Pro baseball stadium opens for overnight guests on Airbnb
item.description: It's a real life field of dreams.

item.title: Kendall Jenner's 'twin' steps into spotlight in new show
item.description: There's a new reality show from the Kardashian-Jenner family, but it has a twist. The show centers around a 24-year-old performance artist who has risen to fame over the past five years with his parody Instagram account, where he pretends to be the fraternal twin brother of Kendall Jenner.

item.title: Tiny airport becomes the world's busiest
item.description: Alaska's Anchorage International Airport lacks the waterfalls and razzmatazz of Singapore Changi or the eight runways of Chicago O'Hare.

item.title: Eid al-Fitr: One of the happiest times for Muslims will be a somber affair
item.description: It's no secret that Ramadan this year looked very different for Muslims around the world.

item.title: The mayor of a Brazilian city calls on the President to resign, 'shut up and stay at home'
item.description: The mayor of a Brazilian city that has been badly hit by the coronavirus has rounded on Jair Bolsonaro, saying the President is "co-responsible" for the nation's vast death count.

item.title: US announces travel restrictions on Brazil
Covid-19 is killing Brazil's indigenous people at an alarming rate
item.description: Far from hospitals and often lacking basic infrastructure, Brazil's indigenous people are dying at an alarming rate from Covid-19 with little help in sight.

item.title: In pictures: Latin America's hardest-hit country
item.description: Brazil is one of the few large countries in the world where coronavirus cases — and death rates — are still rising.

item.title: The horrifying reality of Brazil's Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: In Brazil's largest and most badly infected city, coronavirus has yet to peak, yet already the healthcare system is crumbling visibly around us. As doctors struggle valiantly to save lives, the country's President, Jair Bolsonaro, seems more focused on another sick patient: his country's economy.

item.title: What you need to know about coronavirus today
item.description: The message from Dr. Deborah Birx, the White House coronavirus task force coordinator, could not have been any clearer. Wearing a face mask is critical to reducing the spread of coronavirus, especially since many carriers don't even know they're contagious, she said yesterday.

item.title: China's national security law seems impossible to stop
item.description: • OPINION: It's time for Trump to stand up against China over Hong Kong
